intro: Micrargeria barteri, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that disperse easily by wind. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Micrargeria barteri is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
